com.mlt.mkt.chart

Class DataContext

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mlt.mkt.chart.DataContext

  • public class DataContext
extends java.lang.Object
    Plot data context information. Plot data is displayed through a chart plotter that has an information bar, a vertical axis, and a center canvas where prices, volumes, indicators and other drawings are displayed. Plot data must be contextualized to be able to map coordinates to data.
    Author:
    Miquel Sas

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DataContext(PlotterPane chart, PlotData plotData)
      Constructor.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void ensureContext()
      Ensure the context.
      double getCenterCoordinateX(double x)
      Returns the coordinate of the drawing center for a bar, candle, line or histogram, given the starting X coordinate.
      double getCoordinateX(double index)
      Returns the X coordinate where starts the area to plot a given data index.
      double getCoordinateY(double value)
      Returns the Y coordinate, starting at the top of the paint area, given the value.
      int getDataIndex(double x)
      Returns the index on the data given the x coordinate in the plot area.
      double getDataValue(double y)
      Returns the data value given the y coordinate in the plot area.
      double getPeriodWidth()
      Return the width of a period on the chart.
      PlotData getPlotData()
      Return the plot data.
      double getPlotHeight()
      Return the height of the chart canvas.
      double getPlotWidth()
      Return the width of the chart canvas.
      boolean isInitialized()
      Check whether the context has been initialized.

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        The Y coordinate for the argument value.
